intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium protensum, commonly known as the upright hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with hairy stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped. Its flowers are yellow and appear in clusters, and it is often found in meadows and grasslands. Hieracium protensum is known for its ability to thrive in disturbed soils and can sometimes be invasive in certain regions.
